results.name: Reversal of n in balanced ternary representation.
comment: As the graph demonstrates, the sequence makes large negative steps at terms (3^i+1)/2. These steps divide the graph into conspicuous blocks. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jul 03 2016
reference: D. E. Knuth, The Art of Computer Programming, Addison-Wesley, Reading, MA, Vol 2, pp 173-175.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
program: return sum(l[i]*3**i for i in range(len(l)))
print([a(n) for n in range(101)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Jun 10 2017
xref: Cf. A117966 (balanced ternary representation), A030102, A134021, A274107.
A134027 gives the numbers whose balanced ternary representation is palindromic.
